name: Surveillance quotidienne de la présence en ligne de l'entreprise avec analyse de sentiment AI et suivi multi-plateforme
description:
Comment ça fonctionne

Ce flux de travail fournit un aperçu quotidien complet de la présence en ligne de l'entreprise choisie. Il automatise :

- L'analyse de diverses sources en ligne, y compris Google News, Reddit et YouTube, pour les mentions de votre entreprise spécifiée et des mots-clés.

- L'utilisation de l'intelligence artificielle pour analyser le sentiment (positif, négatif, neutre) et fournir des résumés concis pour chaque nouvelle mention.

- Le suivi intelligent et la dé-duplication du contenu à l'aide d'une base de données locale persistante, garantissant que vous ne recevez d'alertes que pour de véritables nouvelles discussions ou articles, évitant ainsi les notifications redondantes.

- La compilation d'un rapport quotidien structuré et catégorisé détaillant les nouvelles mentions par source et sentiment.

- La livraison de ce rapport perspicace directement dans votre boîte de réception email.

Obtenez une visibilité sans précédent sur la réputation en ligne de votre entreprise et la perception publique à travers divers canaux numériques !

**Étapes de configuration**

La configuration de ce flux de travail complet est plus complexe, prenant généralement entre 25 et 50 minutes, en raison de multiples sources de données, de l'intégration de l'IA et de la gestion de la base de données. Vous devrez :

- Définir le nom de votre entreprise et une liste complète de mots-clés de recherche.

- Authentifier votre service email préféré (par exemple, Gmail).

- Obtenir une clé API pour votre service AI choisi (par exemple, OpenAI).

- Authentifier votre compte Reddit.

- Authentifier votre compte Google (YouTube) (pour l'accès à l'API YouTube).

- Comprendre les nuances de la surveillance générale d'internet, en reconnaissant qu'il est pratiquement impossible de capturer "tout" le contenu sans des outils d'entreprise hautement spécialisés (et coûteux).

Toutes les instructions de configuration détaillées et les conseils de configuration spécifiques sont fournis dans le flux de travail lui-même à l'aide de notes autocollantes.

notes.text:
### 1. Daily Morning Trigger (9 AM)

This `Cron` node triggers the workflow automatically every **day at 9:00 AM** (based on your n8n server's local time zone). This provides a regular daily digest of activity.

**To change the schedule:** Adjust the 'Hour' and 'Minute' fields to your preferred time for receiving the report.

### 2. Set Company Details

This `Set` node defines the company you want to monitor and the keywords to search for.

**Setup (CRITICAL!):**
1.  **`companyName`:** Change `YourCompanyNameHere` to the exact name of the company you are monitoring (e.g., 'Google', 'Coca-Cola'). This is used for the email subject and AI prompts.
2.  **`searchKeywords`:** List all relevant keywords, including common misspellings, product names, hashtags, or related terms. These will be used for searching news, Reddit, and YouTube. Example: `["Acme Corp", "AcmeCo", "#AcmeCorp", "AcmeSoftware"]`

### 3.1. Fetch Google News RSS

This `RSS Feed` node fetches news articles from Google News that mention your `companyName`.

**Setup:**
1.  **URL:** It's pre-configured to search Google News using your `companyName`. You can adjust the `hl` (host language) and `gl` (geo location) parameters if needed.

**Note:** Google News RSS is a good general news source, but it might not capture every single article across all sites.

### 3.2. Prepare News for Merge

This `Function` node standardizes the news articles' data into a consistent format (`source`, `title`, `text`, `link`, `publishedAt`) for later merging and AI processing.

**No configuration needed.**

### 3.3. Search Reddit Posts

This `Reddit` node searches for posts containing your `searchKeywords`.

**Setup:**
1.  **Reddit Credential:** Click 'Credentials' and select 'New Credential'. Choose 'Reddit OAuth2 API'. Follow n8n documentation for detailed steps to create a Reddit app (type 'script') and get your client ID and secret. You'll also need your Reddit username/password for authentication.
2.  **Query:** It's pre-configured to search using your `searchKeywords` joined by ' OR '.
3.  **Limit & Sort:** Adjust the number of results (`limit`) and `sort` order as needed.

**Note:** Reddit API has rate limits, so be mindful of how often you run this if you increase the limit significantly.

### 3.4. Prepare Reddit for Merge

This `Function` node standardizes the Reddit posts' data, ensuring consistent `source`, `title`, `text`, `link`, and `publishedAt` fields for merging.

**No configuration needed.**

### 3.5. Search YouTube Videos

This `YouTube` node searches for videos mentioning your `searchKeywords`.

**Setup:**
1.  **Google Credential:** Click 'Credentials' and select 'New Credential'. Choose 'Google OAuth2 API'. You'll need to enable the YouTube Data API v3 in your Google Cloud Project and configure OAuth2 credentials (Client ID/Secret) for desktop app/other. This can be complex; search n8n docs for 'Google OAuth2' for detailed steps.
2.  **Search:** Pre-configured to use your `searchKeywords`.
3.  **Limit & Order:** Adjust the number of results and order as needed.

**Note:** YouTube API has quotas, so excessive searches might lead to temporary limits.

### 3.6. Prepare YouTube for Merge

This `Function` node standardizes YouTube video data into the common format (`source`, `title`, `text`, `link`, `publishedAt`) for merging.

**No configuration needed.**

### 4. Merge All Mentions

This `Item Lists` node combines all prepared data from Google News, Reddit, and YouTube into a single, unified list. This is the stream of all potential mentions.

**No configuration needed.**

### 5.1. SQLite: Ensure Table Exists

This `SQLite` node ensures a local database table named `processed_mentions` exists. This table will store a hash of every mention seen, preventing duplicate notifications over time.

**Setup:**
* **Database:** `company_monitor` (this creates a file `company_monitor.db` in your n8n data directory).
* **Query:** The `CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS` query is pre-filled.

**No further action needed**; this node runs automatically.

parameters.query: CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS processed_mentions (link_hash TEXT PRIMARY KEY, source TEXT, title TEXT, link TEXT, processed_date TEXT)

notes.text:
### 5.2. Filter New Mentions (Deduplication)

This `Function` node generates a unique hash for each mention (based on its link/title) and then checks the `processed_mentions` database to see if it's already been seen. **Only truly new mentions are passed on.**

**Setup:**
* It uses `crypto` (built-in) for hashing.
* It executes the 'SQLite: Check If Processed' node for each item.

**Important:** If you change the `SQLite: Check If Processed` node's name, update it here. Also, ensure 'Run Once Per Item' is OFF for this Function node.

### (Helper) SQLite: Check If Processed

This helper `SQLite` node is called by the 'Filter New Mentions' Function node to check if a specific `link_hash` already exists in the database.

**No direct configuration needed**; it's managed by the Function node.

parameters.query: SELECT link_hash FROM processed_mentions WHERE link_hash = '{{ $json.linkHash }}'

notes.text:
### 6. AI: Analyze Sentiment & Summarize

This `OpenAI` node processes each *new* mention to determine its sentiment and generate a brief summary.

**Setup:**
1.  **OpenAI Credential:** Select your OpenAI API Key credential.
2.  **Model:** `gpt-3.5-turbo` is selected. For more robust analysis, consider `gpt-4o`.
3.  **Prompt:** The system prompt guides the AI to output sentiment and summary in a structured JSON format, making it easy to parse in the next step.

**Output:** Each item will have a `choices` field containing the AI's JSON output.

### 7. Process AI Results & Categorize

This `Function` node parses the AI's JSON output and categorizes all *new* mentions by their sentiment (Positive, Negative, Neutral). It also handles potential AI parsing errors.

**Output:** A single item containing categorized lists of new mentions (e.g., `positive: [...]`, `negative: [...]`).

**No configuration needed.**

### 8. SQLite: Record Processed Mentions

This `SQLite` node records all the *newly processed* mentions into your `processed_mentions` database. This is crucial for the deduplication step in future runs.

**Setup:**
* **Database:** `company_monitor`
* **Query:** The `INSERT INTO` query is pre-filled, storing the unique hash and other details of the processed mention.

**No further action needed**; it automatically stores the data.

parameters.query: INSERT INTO processed_mentions (link_hash, source, title, link, processed_date) VALUES ('{{ $json.linkHash }}', '{{ $json.source }}', '{{ $json.title }}', '{{ $json.link }}', '{{ new Date().toISOString() }}')

notes.text:
### 9. Format Report Email

This `Function` node constructs the final email body. It groups mentions by sentiment and provides summaries and links for each. It also handles the case where no *new* mentions were found.

**Customization:**
* You can adjust the headings, introduction, or the level of detail for each mention.
* The email body uses Markdown for formatting (bolding, lists).

**No configuration needed.**

### 10. Send Report Email

This `Gmail` node sends the compiled daily online presence report to your mailbox.

**Setup:**
1.  **Gmail Credential:** Select your Gmail API credential.
2.  **From Email:** Enter your Gmail address (must match the authenticated account).
3.  **To Email:** **IMPORTANT: Change `YOUR_RECIPIENT_EMAIL@example.com` to your actual email address!**
4.  **Subject & Text:** These fields pull the formatted subject and body from the previous 'Format Report Email' node.

**Test this node by running the workflow** to ensure you receive the email.

user.name: Piotr Sobolewski
user.bio: AI PhD with 7 years experience as a game dev CEO, currently teaching, helping others and building something new.

data.details: The Cron node uses Cron under the hood - a time-based job scheduler in Unix-like computer operating systems. Use this node when you want to trigger workflows periodically, especially in more complex scenarios like "every Tuesday at 9 am" or "Weekdays".

data.details: The Function node allows you to execute JavaScript in your workflow. Unlike the Function Item node, this node does not operate on incoming node data per-item. Instead, you must iterate over multiple items of incoming data yourself. This can be useful if you're performing data transformation where you want to manipulate the number of items being outputted by the node (i.e. 1 item is inputted in with nested object, 10 items are outputted without any nested objects)
